Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: authchanger
Description: Authchanger is a utility included with Jamf Connect to help you manage the authorization database used by macOS to determine how the login process progresses

Arguments.Name: -print
Arguments.Description: Prints the current list of authorization mechanisms

Arguments.Name: -debug
Arguments.Description: Does a dry run of the changes and prints out what would have happened

Arguments.Name: -reset
Arguments.Description: Resets the login screen to the factory settings

Arguments.Name: -demobilize
Arguments.Description: Sets up Jamf Connect Login to only demobilze accounts

Arguments.Name: -notify
Arguments.Description: Adds the DEP Notify addition to the corresponding -AD, or -Setup argument

Arguments.Name: -setup
Arguments.Description: Adds the DEP Notify addition to the corresponding -AD, or -Setup argument

Arguments.Name: -prelogin
Arguments.Description: Mechs to be used before the actual UI is shown

Arguments.Name: -preauth
Arguments.Description: Mechs to be used between the login UI and actual authentication

Arguments.Name: -postauth
Arguments.Description: Mechs to be used after system authentication

Arguments.Name: -customrule
Arguments.Description: Allows the printout of any authorizationDB rule as well as setting of that rule to any custom mechanism(s)

Arguments.Name: -sysprefs
Arguments.Description: Enables Azure authentication for the Network Preference Pane

Arguments.Name: -sysprefsreset
Arguments.Description: Removes Azure authentication for the Network Preference Pane

Arguments.Name: -defaultjcright
Arguments.Description: Adds the mechanism to be used with the sudosaml binary
